text:
HEAR my crýing, O Gód,
give ear únto my práyer. 2 From the ends of the earth will I cáll upon thée,
when my héart is in héaviness. 3 O set me up upon the rock that is hígher than Í;
for thou hast been my hope, and a strong tower for me agáinst the énemy. 4 I will dwell in thy tábernacle foréver,
and my trust shall be under the cóvering of thy wíngs. 5 For thou, O Lord, hast héard my desíres,
and hast given an heritage unto those that féar thy Náme. 6 Thou shalt grant the Kíng a long lífe,
that his years may endure throughout áll generátions. 7 He shall dwell before Gód foréver:
O prepare thy loving mercy and faithfulness, that théy may préserve him. 8 So will I alway sing práise unto thy Náme,
that I máy daily perfórm my vóws. 9 Glory be to the Father, and tó the Són,
and to the Hóly Ghóst; 10 As it was in the beginning, † is now, and éver sháll be,
world wíthout énd. Amen. THE TWELFTH DAY Morning Prayer
